meanings.sent1: The door was blockable by placing a chair in front of it.
meanings.sent2: The website had a blockable pop-up that was easily closed.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the blockable box and decided to take a nap inside.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were like a blockable dam, ready to burst at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The blockable obstacle course challenged the participants to find creative solutions.

meanings.definition: Capable of being obstructed or stopped.
meanings.sent1: The drain was blockable with leaves, causing a flood in the street.
meanings.sent2: The signal was blockable by interference from nearby buildings.
meanings.sent3: The blockable traffic jam turned into an unexpected street party.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a blockable river, flowing freely one moment and dammed the next.
meanings.sent5: The blockable avalanche of snow made the mountain slope dangerous for skiers.
